column4: sorry guys, but how is it possible that i can never report the correct quantity of used RAM that i have?
The only possibility is, that you do not know about the existence of the "free -m" command.
The complete output in a pastebin is important.
You are - technically. RAM not used by applications will be used for caching, which is good, very goog.
Assigned memory does not equal used memory in terms of virtualization.
Why? Isnt a SSD designed to write things, too?
If so, mount the FS read-only...
two hours of continuous SSD wirtes @ 20mbps? have fun with that
I have much more constant writes here, when doing things.
well, pardon me but i would prefer not having useless ssd activity going on in the background
My activity is usefull... like deploying VMs massively, etc.
So whats causing your I/O then?
Tried using a fresh user or using another desktop environment?
So it didnt happen for hours now, correct?
it did because i noticed the red led of hdd activity some hours ago, but didn't bother looking what it was
